metadata.title: CVE-2022-4645 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
LibTIFF 4.4.0 has an out-of-bounds read in tiffcp in tools/tiffcp.c:948,allowing attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file.For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available withcommit e8131125.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5').
